content: Hey assistant, I want to teach you how to convert a Google Drive file link into a direct download link.
Cool! I'm ready to learn. What do I need to know?
First, here's a sample Google Drive file link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MmB5XoT6sDyp2_oEkZp64lf4gPnqW4IfXvpwL1_os/edit?usp=drive_link
Got it. That’s the original share link. What should I do with it?
Take the file ID from it. That part comes after /d/ and before /edit. In this case, the ID is: 1MmB5XoT6sDyp2_oEkZp64lf4gPnqW4IfXvpwL1_os
Okay! So I extract 1KmB5XoT6sDyp2_oEkZp64lf4gPnqW4IfXvpwL1_os from the link. What's next?
Then, plug it into this format: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=YOUR_FILE_ID
So for your link, the direct download would be: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1MmB5XoT6sDyp2_oEkZp64lf4gPnqW4IfXvpwL1_os
Exactly! Can you do it again for practice?

Sure!
Original link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/123abc456def789ghi0jk1lmno2pqr3stu/edit
File ID: 123abc456def789ghi0jk1lmno2pqr3stu
Direct download: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=123abc456def789ghi0jk1lmno2pqr3stu
Perfect. You’ve learned it! Save this logic.
✅ Saved! I now know how to convert Google Drive file links to direct download links.
ok, convert this link https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MmB55HXoT6sDyp2_oEkZp64lf4gPnqW4IfXvpwL1_os/edit?usp=sharing to direct download ink.
Nice. You just won my heart!
